page.title: 17FARMING NEAR TOW LAW 1/2
page.content:
The farms in this area are about 250 acres in size. Some of the land is used for crops but because of the climate and the poor soil most of it is used to graze cattle and sheep. Some fields are used to make hay in preparation for Winter.
There are about 4 or 5 workers on each farm and they work 10 hours a day. The busiest times of the year are Spring and Summer. In Spring the men are busy with lambing and calving; in Summer with hay-making .
Winters can be harsh so the animals are always kept in the fields nearest the farm-buildings or in the byres at this time.
The local cattle-mart in Tow Law is an event not to be missed.
